snippet: Foremen and repair crews spent a big part of many workdays running personal errands, an inspector general concluded.
abstract: Investigation by inspector general for Metropolitan Transportation Authority finds that Metro-North Railroad foreman and repair crews have repeatedly falsified time sheets, spent large stretches of work days running personal errands and misused agency-issued vehicles; findings suggest Metro-North 'lacks appropriate internal controls.'
lead_paragraph: Foremen and repair crews spent a big part of many workdays running personal errands, an inspector general concluded.

headline.main: Metro-North Railroad Time Sheets Were Falsified, Inquiry Says
headline.print_headline: Time Sheets Falsified at Railroad, Inquiry Says
